content: this elegant vintage style blanket comes in 5 sizes on my site 3 additional sizes are included in the paid pdf *this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience * **difficulty ** easy/intermediate techniques used post stitches puff stitches cross stitches half-double_crochet in the 3rd loop **materials needed ** 2000 2250 2500 3750 5400 8650 11550 14600 yards #3 light weight bernat baby sport in baby taupe 5 5mm i hook or hook needed to obtain gauge scissors yarn needle **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpsc = front post single_crochet fptr2tog = front post treble_crochet 2 together hdc2tog = half_double_crochet 2 together rs = right side ws = wrong side st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces prev = previous **additional terms ** working in the 3rd loop of half_double_crochet look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop seed stitch alternate single_crochet and double_crochet stitches across the designated row then on the next row work a double_crochet stitch in the single_crochet stitch from the previous row and a single_crochet stitch in the double_crochet stitch from the previous row half_double_crochet puff st yo pull up a stitch 5 times pull through 10 loops on hook yo pull through final 2 loops cross st skip st double_crochet in next st cross over st just made double_crochet in skipped st shell 4 double_crochet in same st **gauge ** 13 sts using the seed stitch pattern in 4 each row 2-34 repeat measures approximately 12 tall before blocking **measurements ** * these are approximate dimensions * receiving blanket 40 by 40 crib blanket 36 x 50 toddler blanket 40 x 50 small throw 50 x 60 large throw 60 x 72 **additional notes ** -chain 1 at beginning of row does not count as a stitch -chain-2 and chain-3 at beginning of a new row do count as stitches you may replace the chain-2 with a half_double_crochet and the chain-3 with a double_crochet if you prefer chain-1 to turn if you decide to make that substitution -this blanket is worked in 2 separate pieces and then sewed together so that the pattern on both ends of the blanket is the same -this blanket will require some blocking to even out the side edges
